ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Approaches and thought processes behind developing a model, combining multiple models

You learn about different types of modeling and how to do it. Also you learn how to read modeling papers and make sense of it. Really you learn how to do different scales of modeling and building in that.
Modeling and coupling multiple levels of biological systems to develop cohesive knowledge of inner workings of a variety of biological phenomena.
How to simplify models, and when they are too simplified. P

Usage of continuity (and the difficulties associated)
Reading through and evaluating academic papers

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Balanced workload, hands on, journal review is good at bringing what we do in class into the real world or research.
The strengths of this class is how chill the class setting is. It was really nice it was a small class like seminar. I think it could be improved with our setting of classroom.

Great course, great instructor, can't complain. I think the software we used at the end was somewhat difficult to work with, but weirdly illuminated my knowledge of FEA. Instructor is aware of the roadblocks that exist with the software, though.
It is super cool to have so much hands-on time throughout the course. It was never more than 1 full lecture day until we would get to tryout something on our own.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely take. A pretty chill but interesting course for upper level undergraduates and grad students. Prof Campbell is the best, very helpful and kind professor that just wants to help his students learn.
Yes, well run and interesting. Good balance of lecture, hands on work, and journal review.
Most definitely, already have! Great intellectual course that makes you think differently about phenomena.
Yes, very much so. This was a fun and engaging introduction into computational modeling, and did so in a variety of fields. The challenge is also approachable and then ramps up.
